meanings.definition: To increase the speed or rate of acceleration again.
meanings.sent1: After slowing down, the car reaccelerates quickly.
meanings.sent2: The athlete reaccelerates to catch up with the leading runner.
meanings.sent3: The turtle challenged the hare to a race, but the hare reaccelerated and won easily.
meanings.sent4: As the music tempo increased, the dancers reaccelerated their movements.
meanings.sent5: The rocket reaccelerates, propelling itself into outer space.

meanings.sent1: When the storm passed, the wind reaccelerated, blowing even stronger.
meanings.sent2: The car reaccelerates after the traffic light turns green.
meanings.sent3: The chef reaccelerated the cooking process to serve the meal on time.
meanings.sent4: The river reaccelerated its flow after the dam was opened.
meanings.sent5: The runner reaccelerates, sprinting towards the finish line.
